did.unittitle: Donald A. Clark research files on William Bull Nelson
did.abstract: The Donald A. Clark research files on William Bull Nelson (dated 1995-2021, undated; 8.6 cubic feet; 10 boxes, 2 oversize folders) primarily comprise the research materials, correspondence, photos, images, newspaper clippings, maps, and drafts collected and created by Donald A. Clark.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Donald Andrew Clark (1941-) is an American businessperson, veteran, and writer of historical books, such as The Notorious 'Bull' Nelson: Murdered Civil War General. After earning his degree from Centre College of Kentucky in 1963, he enlisted in the army and went on to serve in Vietnam as an infantry officer. Upon release, he went on to own and operate various business enterprises before retiring to devote the rest of his life to history.

William Bull Nelson (1824-1862) was a United States naval officer who became a Union general during the American Civil War. While wounded at the Battle of Richmond, Nelson was forced to retreat to Louisville. General Jefferson C. Davis, while there, reported to Nelson, who was dissatisfied with his performance and insulted him in front of witnesses. A few days later, Davis demanded a public apology, however, the situation rapidly escalated into a physical confrontation, which concluded in Davis mortally wounding Nelson with a pistol.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 2021ms063: [identification of item], Donald A. Clark research files on William Bull Nelson, 1995-2021, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Donald A. Clark research files on William Bull Nelson (dated 1995-2021; 8.6 cubic feet; 10 boxes, 2 oversize folders) primarily comprise the research materials, correspondence, photos, images, newspaper clippings, maps, and drafts collected and created by Donald A. Clark. The research materials cover mainly William Bull Nelson's life and time in the U.S. military. The photos document historic war sites and other relevant places, as do the maps. The correspondence is mainly between Clark and his colleagues and publishers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Background - Training: Mexican War series (2000-2014) primarily comprises research materials covering William Nelson's military training, time at Norwich University, time at Naval Academy, and service in the Mexican-American War.

unittitle.title: Drumbeats in the Valley: A Story of Life at Norwich University in the Early Nineteenth Century

did.unittitle: U.S. Exploring Expedition - Images and maps

Edward J. Marolda - The Washington Navy Yard: An Illustrated History
Lincoln Guns, Camp Dick Robinson, Big Sandy Expedition, 1860-1861

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lincoln Guns, Camp Dick Robinson, Big Sandy Expedition, 1860-1861 series (2000-2021) primarily comprises research materials, images, and maps covering Camp Dick Robinson, several officers, several volunteer infantries, and the Big Sandy Expedition.

unittitle.title: The Story of Camp Dick Robinson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Camp Wickliffe, 1861-1862 (2001-2015) primarily comprises research materials, maps, and images covering William Nelson's time at the Camp Wickliffe training camp.

unittitle.title: Entrepreneurial Invention and Innovation in the Miami Valley during the Civil War

did.unittitle: Shiloh, Siege of Corinth, Chattanooga Campaign

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Shiloh, Siege of Corinth, Chattanooga Campaign, 1861-1862 series (2000-2016) primarily comprises research materials, maps, reports, and images covering Shiloh, the Seige of Corinth, and the Chattanooga Campaign.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Louisville Murder, 1862 September series (2000-2019) primarily comprises research materials, maps, reports, and images covering Louisville, Nelson's murder, and media surrounding the murder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Drafts series (2000-2012) primarily comprises drafts of Donald A. Clark's books.

scopecontent.p: The Florence M. Cornyn series (2000-2014) primarily comprises research materials, images, maps, and correspondence covering Florence M. Cornyn, Corinth, Bowen, Jefferson Davis, Missouri, and the Cornyn family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Audiovisual Materials series (1997-2011) comprises of photos covering Donald A. Clark's booksigning and travels to important sites of William Nelson's life, and a disk.
